CatDescriptText: James Belines, waiter, East Liberty and William Webber, waiter, Dravosburg, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 16, 1960, pg. A1 with question "What role, if any, do you think the United States should play in the present South African situation?  Do you think United Nations' intervention is enough?"  Mr. Belines' answer reads: "We have no jurisdiction there, but we could do something by freeing the people here in the South...UN action should be stronger.  The organization should really put its foot down and let South Africa know that the treatment of the colored people there is inhuman."  Mr. Webber's answer reads: "Yes, the Government should step in, in some way that will not bring on war.  I  think that UN action is strong enough."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James Belines wearing light colored coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of William Webber wearing plaid shirt and bolo tie, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
